name: Babylonale: Silent Film Classics with Live Orchestra
description: Historic 1920s cinema presents seven silent film classics accompanied live by the Babylon Orchestra Berlin. On Valentine's Day, the program features Charlie Chaplin's "The Circus," for which he received his first Academy Award at the inaugural Oscar ceremony in 1929. A rare opportunity to experience silent cinema as it was originally meant to be seen, with live orchestral accompaniment lending incredible dynamism and depth to the images.
